p: The significance of the antigenic variation of HRSV groups in epidemiology is not yet clear. The antigenic dimorphism, although at modest rates, seems to contribute to the high incidence of reinfections during the first years of life. However, several reinfections in children involving viruses of the same group have been reported [ 60, 83]. In addition, there is no indication that reinfection with a heterologous group induces more serious clinical signs than reinfection with homologous samples [ 110].
